ggdag
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Common Structures of Bias
    • An Introduction to Directed Acyclic Graphs
    • An Introduction to ggdag

Adjust for variables and activate any biasing paths that result

Adjust for variables and activate any biasing paths that result

control_for(.tdy_dag, var, as_factor = TRUE, ...)

ggdag_adjust(.tdy_dag, var = NULL, ..., node_size = 16, text_size = 3.88,
  text_col = "white", node = TRUE, text = TRUE, use_labels = NULL)

Arguments

.tdy_dag

input graph, an object of class tidy_dagitty or dagitty
var

a character vector, the variable(s) to adjust for.
as_factor

logical. Should the adjusted column be a factor?
...

additional arguments passed to tidy_dagitty()
node_size

size of DAG node
text_size

size of DAG text
text_col

color of DAG text
node

logical. Should nodes be included in the DAG?
text

logical. Should text be included in the DAG?
use_labels

a string. Variable to use for geom_dag_repel_label(). Default is NULL.

Value

a tidy_dagitty with a adjusted column for adjusted variables, as well as any biasing paths that arise, or a ggplot

Examples

dag <- dagify(m ~ a + b, x ~ a, y ~ b)

control_for(dag, var = "m")
#> # A tibble: 8 x 14
#>   name  from      x     y direction type     to     xend  yend .ggraph.orig_in…
#>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <fct>     <fct>    <chr> <dbl> <dbl>            <int>
#> 1 a     a      16.3  15.6 ->        directed m      17.4  14.6                1
#> 2 a     a      16.3  15.6 ->        directed x      15.4  16.5                1
#> 3 b     b      18.4  13.6 ->        directed m      17.4  14.6                2
#> 4 b     b      18.4  13.6 ->        directed y      19.4  12.8                2
#> 5 m     m      17.4  14.6 <NA>      <NA>     <NA>   NA    NA                  3
#> 6 x     x      15.4  16.5 <NA>      <NA>     <NA>   NA    NA                  4
#> 7 y     y      19.4  12.8 <NA>      <NA>     <NA>   NA    NA                  5
#> 8 a     a      16.3  15.6 <->       bidirec… b      18.4  13.6               NA
#> # ... with 4 more variables: circular <lgl>, .ggraph.index <int>,
#> #   collider_line <lgl>, adjusted <fct>
ggdag_adjust(dag, var = "m")
